verbose_text: Metabolic clues for intracellular and in vivo replication are the degradation of phosphorylated glucose via the PPP, the utilization of C 3 -bodies as alternative carbon- and energy source, pyruvate as a sink for central metabolism including downstream reactions such as pyruvate decarboxylation, biosynthesis of BCAAs, the availability of thiamine, and the acquisition of host cell derived nitrogen sources including ethanolamine.
evidence: phosphorylated glucose via the PPP, the utilization of C 3 -bodies as alternative carbon- and energy source, pyruvate as a sink for central metabolism including downstream reactions such as pyruvate decarboxylation, biosynthesis of BCAAs, the availability of thiamine
